dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4094 IH: Electronic Consent Accountability Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Brown (for herself and Ms. Mace) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To direct certain Federal agencies to report to Congress on whether such agencies have implemented guidance from the Office of Management and Budget with respect to the disclosure of personal information, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Electronic Consent Accountability Act of 2025.

paragraph.text: The Government Accountability Office reports that Federal agencies need to fully implement Office of Management and Budget guidance and requirements related to the disclosure of personal information.

The Creating Advanced Streamlined Electronic Services for Constituents Act of 2019 (CASES Act; Public Law 116–50) required the Office of Management and Budget to issue guidance to Federal agencies that requires—

subparagraph.text: acceptance of electronic identity proofing and authentication;
creation of a template for electronic consent and access forms to be posted on the websites of such agencies; and
acceptance of electronic consent from individuals after the identification of such individuals has been properly authenticated.

paragraph.text: On November 12, 2020, the Office of Management and Budget issued guidance in the memorandum of the Office of Management and Budget designated M–21–04 that included the required elements described in the CASES Act.
Federal agencies were instructed to implement the requirements described in such guidance by November 2021.

section.header: Report to Congress on implementation of guidance

subsection.text: Not later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the head of each agency specified in subsection (b) shall submit to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform of the House of Representatives a report that includes—

paragraph.text: whether such head has implemented the covered responsibilities; and
if such head has not implemented the covered responsibilities—

subparagraph.text: a justification for why such head has not implemented such responsibilities;
the planned timeline for such head to implement such responsibilities; and
the steps such head is taking to implement such responsibilities.

subsection.text: The agencies specified in this subsection are the following:

paragraph.text: The Department of Health and Human Services.
The National Archives and Records Administration.

subsection.text: In this section, the term covered responsibilities means the agency responsibilities described in the memorandum of the Office of Management and Budget designated as M–21–04, relating to Modernizing Access to and Consent for Disclosure of Records Subject to the Privacy Act, and issued November 12, 2020.
